The Elder Pañcahatthiya’s Birth Story
“The Buddha called Sumedha,
was going to the market town;
With eyes cast down, speaking little,
mindful, with faculties restrained.
Five handfuls of lotuses,
they gave to me;
With those hands I worshipped the Buddha,
and was satisfied with those hands.
And those flowers were placed
as a covering for the Teacher;
The great nāga was concentrated,
like a pupil to his teacher.
For twenty-thousand eons,
the flowers I placed (on the Buddha);
I do not know of a bad destination,
this is the fruit of worshipping the Buddha.
For twenty-hundred eons,
there were five nobles;
They were called by the name of Hatthiyā,
universal monarchs of great strength.
The four analytical insights,
I have done the Buddha’s bidding.”🔽Thus the venerable Elder Pañcahatthiya recited these verses.
